definition: to go abroad as ambassador/to be sent on a diplomatic mission

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: One is to make the powder so that you can't mix it with dirty water.
sentences.chinese: 一个就是制作出使人不能和脏水混合的奶粉。

sentences.english: During the Western Han Dynasty, who was twice sent on a diplomatic mission to the western territories?
sentences.chinese: 西汉年间，曾两度出使西域的是以下哪一位？

sentences.english: The past year has seen a flurry of ministerial visits to Latin America.
sentences.chinese: 过去的一年中，英国官员频繁出使拉美各国。

sentences.english: He uttered the hardship of the mission to Confucius as soon as talk started.
sentences.chinese: 沈先生一见面就向孔子倾述这回出使齐国的艰难之处。

sentences.english: Lin Xiangru was the envoy the Zhao state detached to the Qin State.
sentences.chinese: 蔺相如是赵国出使秦国的使臣。

sentences.english: In the Warring States Period, Lin Xiangru, chief min-ister of the State of Zhao, was sent as an envoy to the State of Qin to ask the ruler of Qin to return a fine piece of jade to Zhao.
sentences.chinese: 战国时代，赵国的大臣蔺相如出使到秦国。

definition: to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to go on a punitive expedition
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
credentials (of a diplomat)/documents exchanged between nations/national or dynastic history book
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
